content: <rss xmlns:a10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" version="2.0"><channel><title>Impatient Optimists</title><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/</link><description>URL filterable feed of blog posts</description><language>en</language><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{4EF217E7-4394-41FF-9C66-DE1EDDF3304B}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/02/CAREs-dairy-value-chain-Making-markets-work-for-smallholder-farmers-in-Bangladesh</link><a10:author><a10:name>Kevin McKague, Muhamad Siddiquee</a10:name></a10:author><title>CARE\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds dairy value chain: Making markets work for smallholder farmers in Bangladesh</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/02/CAREs-dairy-value-chain-Making-markets-work-for-smallholder-farmers-in-Bangladesh"><img src="" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Many of us dream of a world free from poverty, but how can this be realistically achieved, especially for smallholder farmers who make up the majority of the world\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds poor?</p></description><pubDate>Fri, 13 Feb 2015 16:37:26 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Kevin McKague, Muhamad Siddiquee</author><postImage type="author"></postImage><topic>Agricultural Development</topic><program>Poverty</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{160B88E6-E773-492E-8C90-B4DD6C4FC680}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/01/How-to-feed-9-billion</link><a10:author><a10:name>Mark Suzman</a10:name></a10:author><title>How to feed 9 billion: Place your bet </title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/01/How-to-feed-9-billion"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/J/JA-JE/jamieolived96e805ddc744fec8310a4c076ec37b9png_png_autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>In their Annual Letter this year, Bill and Melinda Gates are making a big bet for the next 15 years \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd that the lives of people in poor countries will improve faster in the next 15 years than at any other time in history thanks to breakthroughs in health,  farming, banking, and education. </p></description><pubDate>Fri, 16 Jan 2015 18:37:25 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Mark Suzman</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/J/JA-JE/jamieolived96e805ddc744fec8310a4c076ec37b9png_png_autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Nutrition|Agricultural Development</topic><program>Poverty</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{2B73A522-60B3-488A-9465-6723A4C141AD}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/The-Case-for-a-Safe-Space-Libraries-Empower-Women-In-Asia</link><a10:author><a10:name>Tina Sciabica</a10:name></a10:author><title>The Case for a Safe Space: Libraries Empower Women In Asia</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/The-Case-for-a-Safe-Space-Libraries-Empower-Women-In-Asia"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/M/MA-ME/meet-chun68dd5575a2584d63b5c4ef53d154f604png_png_autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Libraries are a solution: they offer an &quot;integrated delivery&quot; model that provides women with a safe space and access to essential information on health, livelihoods, rights, and more.</p></description><pubDate>Mon, 08 Dec 2014 15:23:07 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Tina Sciabica</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/M/MA-ME/meet-chun68dd5575a2584d63b5c4ef53d154f604png_png_autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Libraries|Agricultural Development|Financial Services for the Poor|Maternal, Newborn, &amp; Child Health</topic><program>Poverty</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{61E60C11-5E6A-45B8-9019-D6A1AFFE755E}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/The-Last-Hunger-Season-Part-1--The-Expanding-Possibilities-of-Family-Farmers</link><a10:author><a10:name>Roger Thurow</a10:name></a10:author><title>The Last Hunger Season, Part 1 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The Expanding Possibilities of Family Farmers</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/The-Last-Hunger-Season-Part-1--The-Expanding-Possibilities-of-Family-Farmers"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Other/T/TF-TI/thurowroger_db_thumb_jpg_autocropped.jpg?w=73" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Zipporah Biketi was living in a shrinking world when I first met her back in 2011. Her imagination rarely stretched beyond the boundaries of her small family farm in western Kenya</p></description><pubDate>Mon, 08 Dec 2014 11:57:46 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Roger Thurow</author><postImage type="author">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Other/T/TF-TI/thurowroger_db_thumb_jpg_autocropped.jpg?w=73</postImage><topic>Agricultural Development</topic><program>Poverty</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{AD147BD4-2824-4DFE-9C71-59DEDE535EC1}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/10/Grand-Challenge-Putting-Women-and-Girls-at-the-Center-of-Development</link><a10:author><a10:name>Gary Darmstadt, Sarah Henry, Luca Passerini</a10:name></a10:author><title>Grand Challenge: Putting Women and Girls at the Center of Development</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/10/Grand-Challenge-Putting-Women-and-Girls-at-the-Center-of-Development"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/L/LP-LZ/lp39149b82a431f292546a3bd32836809c801c5__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Our first Grand Challenge on gender equality and women\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds and girls\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd empowerment signals a more concerted push to put women and girls at the center of our work.</p></description><pubDate>Mon, 06 Oct 2014 18:42:12 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Gary Darmstadt, Sarah Henry, Luca Passerini</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/L/LP-LZ/lp39149b82a431f292546a3bd32836809c801c5__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Agricultural Development|Water, Sanitation, &amp; Hygiene|Financial Services for the Poor|HIV/AIDS|Maternal, Newborn, &amp; Child Health</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{C4D1C35D-1B8E-4F20-9B19-EEF33C52175E}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/09/How-Research-Can-Banish-Water-and-Food-Scarcity</link><a10:author><a10:name>Frank Rijsberman</a10:name></a10:author><title>How Research Can Banish Water and Food Scarcity</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/09/How-Research-Can-Banish-Water-and-Food-Scarcity"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/P/PF-PI/photo--sanjini-de-silva-iwmi-volta-basi35061a1356a743b2bcddb2012ffb80d1__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140905113537?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>This week \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd water is on our lips. It\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds a vital resource we all need to live, whether it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds to drink, to nourish the crops we eat, or to power the technologies we rely on. The way in which we try to pull water in these three directions\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdknown as the water-food-energy  nexus\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdis the center of discussion this week, at World Water Week in Stockholm. </p></description><pubDate>Tue, 09 Sep 2014 09:00:00 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Frank Rijsberman</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/P/PF-PI/photo--sanjini-de-silva-iwmi-volta-basi35061a1356a743b2bcddb2012ffb80d1__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140905113537?w=110</postImage><topic>Agricultural Development</topic><program>Poverty</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{2DEC36AD-A7EF-4CBF-B2B7-E81D3C49819F}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/08/Sri-Lanka-Brings-Technology-to-Rural-Residents</link><a10:author><a10:name>Deborah Jacobs</a10:name></a10:author><title>Sri Lanka Brings Technology to Rural Residents</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/08/Sri-Lanka-Brings-Technology-to-Rural-Residents"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/M/MF-MI/mh4186433146c8b19c64faaa9a0f229284dc123__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140815032248?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>The Sri Lankan government's e-Library Nenasala program is bridging the digital divide and bringing technology to the people who need it most.</p></description><pubDate>Mon, 18 Aug 2014 08:00:00 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Deborah Jacobs</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/M/MF-MI/mh4186433146c8b19c64faaa9a0f229284dc123__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140815032248?w=110</postImage><topic>Libraries|Vaccines|Agricultural Development</topic><program>Poverty</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{7AE6A1ED-2CCE-4932-8CD8-7AE11091D59D}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/08/My-first-return-to-Africa-as-CEO-of-the-Gates-Foundation</link><a10:author><a10:name>Sue Desmond-Hellmann</a10:name></a10:author><title>My First Return to Africa as CEO of the Gates Foundation</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/08/My-first-return-to-Africa-as-CEO-of-the-Gates-Foundation"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/S/SP-SZ/sueafrica64a993c2c48b4932bd7b716fc7c004a7__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140812101253?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Sue Desmond-Hellmann describes her recent return to Africa, which holds a special place in her career and her heart. She discusses the progress being made by grantees and partners there.</p></description><pubDate>Tue, 12 Aug 2014 10:12:00 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Sue Desmond-Hellmann</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/S/SP-SZ/sueafrica64a993c2c48b4932bd7b716fc7c004a7__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140812101253?w=110</postImage><topic>Maternal, Newborn, &amp; Child Health|Agricultural Development</topic><program>Poverty</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{BC6BF424-3B8D-451F-BB44-9997EC36A4BF}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/07/My-year-in-Tanzania-witnessing-individual-people-be-a-force-for-change-in-their-community</link><a10:author><a10:name>Laura Birx</a10:name></a10:author><title>My year in Tanzania: witnessing individuals be a force for change</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/07/My-year-in-Tanzania-witnessing-individual-people-be-a-force-for-change-in-their-community"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/T/TA-TE/tanzania0d48f14ed5984ef5b57e59ea7588032e__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140731053003?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Public health training taught me to analyze and consider populations as a whole, rather than focusing on the individual, in order to achieve the broadest impact. My year in Tanzania taught me that while scale is important, one should never underestimate  the power of individual people as a force for change in their communities.</p></description><pubDate>Thu, 31 Jul 2014 05:09:00 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Laura Birx</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/T/TA-TE/tanzania0d48f14ed5984ef5b57e59ea7588032e__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140731053003?w=110</postImage><topic>Community|Agricultural Development</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{E286A1DD-F0AD-47F2-9ED0-CE4F7509AAD0}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/07/We-Can-Prevent-Another-Food-Price-Crisis</link><a10:author><a10:name>Josh Lozman</a10:name></a10:author><title>We Can Prevent Another Food Price Crisis</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/07/We-Can-Prevent-Another-Food-Price-Crisis"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/Other/Other/9419567942f0c17222a941a5065a52904864aa3e79f84b0482be__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140710014829?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Five years ago today, amidst a global economic recession and world food price crisis, world leaders gathered at the G8 summit in L\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAquila, Italy, and made one of the largest financial commitments to fight hunger and poverty alleviation to date \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd $20 billion  in aid to agriculture. </p></description><pubDate>Thu, 10 Jul 2014 12:10:00 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Josh Lozman</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/Other/Other/9419567942f0c17222a941a5065a52904864aa3e79f84b0482be__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140710014829?w=110</postImage><topic>Agricultural Development</topic><program>Poverty</program></item></channel></rss>
